db:abstract.db:para: The QStylePlugin class provides an abstract base for custom QStyle plugins.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QStylePlugin is a simple plugin interface that makes it easy to create custom styles that can be loaded dynamically into applications using the QStyleFactory class.
Writing a style plugin is achieved by subclassing this base class, reimplementing the pure virtual create() function, and exporting the class using the Q_PLUGIN_METADATA() macro.

See How to Create Qt Plugins for details.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QStylePlugin::QStylePlugin(QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a style plugin with the given parent.
Note that this constructor is invoked automatically by the moc generated code that exports the plugin, so there is no need for calling it explicitly.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QStylePlugin::~QStylePlugin()
db:section.db:para: Note that Qt destroys a plugin automatically when it is no longer used, so there is no need for calling the destructor explicitly.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QStyle *QStylePlugin::create(const QString &key)
db:section.db:para: Creates and returns a QStyle object for the given style key. If a plugin cannot create a style, it should return 0 instead.
